title: The French lieutenant's woman (Captioned)
creator_contributor_role: Victorian Council for Children's Films and Television, distributor
viewing_guidelines: CAPTIONED: suitable for hearing impaired viewers
subject_group: Literature/English literature - Film and video adaptations
description: Based on the brilliant novel by John Fowles, with the screenplay written by Harold Pinter, "The French Lieutenant's Woman" is both a classic Victorian love story and an ironic look at an age of double-standard morality. Sarah Woodruff's chance meeting with Charles Smithson, a young man-about-town who subsequently discards his pretty young fiancee in a wave of passion, sets in motion a series of events that disrupts the quiet fishing and seaside village in England, and profoundly affects the lives of its residents.
